Pre-Game Insights: The Detroit Tigers are on a three-game home winning streak.
The Tigers have a strong home record of 41-36 and perform well when hitting at least two home runs.
The Tampa Bay Rays have a 52-11 record when they out-hit their opponents.
This is the sixth meeting between the two teams this season, with the Tigers leading 4-1.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers' overall record is 84-74, while the Rays are 78-80.
Top performers include Riley Greene with a.264 batting average and Christopher Morel with 21 home runs for the Rays.
The Tigers have a 3.07 ERA in their last 10 games, outscoring opponents by nine runs on average.
Injuries for both teams include several players on the IL.
